website_summaries.verdict: If you have an older PC that you need to update with a reliable card, this is the one to get.
pros: This budget priced card is a solid option for PCs, as it is capable of improving graphics and takes up little space
Suitable for games that don't have fast-paced graphics
cons: Driver issues and occasional lag reported
Some had issues installing it on Windows 10 PCs

customer_reviews.title: Does not function with Windows 10.
customer_reviews.text: Go online and read the numerous complaints about the Nvidia Geforce 710 and blackout screens. Don't waste your time and money. This card does not function with Windows 10 and there is no fix that I could find anywhere. Screens loose connection and can't get them back without a hardboot. May last 5 to 10 minutes before they black out again. Not to mention I paid the extra money for next day shipping and it arrived two days later. Completely frustrated with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Solid for my old Duo-Core.
customer_reviews.text: I slapped this baby in my old HP small form factor. I wasn't using my big boy i-5 much as the moment and needed something to give me a little extra graphical edge over the built-in graphics. I used the passive cooling model and didn't need an extra power supply. Worked great for everything I needed it for including some old emulation. Great for epsxe and ppsspp. Not quite up to par pcsx2 or dolphin, though that could probably be put more on my processor than anything. I am considering trying the 2gb model to see if that gives me the performance need for those. So, really a solid product for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: rico

customer_reviews.title: A Small form factor must
customer_reviews.text: If you are dealing with one of the small form factor PC's from Dell or HP and have been struggling to find a video card that can play some games than this is for you. You won't be able to play games in 4K but it blows onboard video away. At 50.00 it is a great deal and installation was very easy. If you are installing it on a low end PC than you need to go to ZOTO's website and down load the standard Windows 10 driver. You can tweak just about any setting that you can think of to get your games running smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Fan  Outwest

customer_reviews.title: Very Bad Product
customer_reviews.text: Read the reviews. Didn't have my expectations too high. Bought it. Screen goes black every 4 hours or so. Recovers quickly. Got online. On going problem for the past 6 years that I know of. All of the websites that offer suggestions say just about the same thing. Evidently this is a piece of junk for some and just what was needed for others. I bought a cheap computer for e-mails and such. Decided to try out the GeForce video card. I have multiple back up computers due to my work. This may work if you have a tiny screen. Mine is 24". I will never buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Garbage !
customer_reviews.text: The Video Card Ships With a Full Size Bracket Designed to Fit into Most Desktop Machines as well as (2) Mount Brackets for Low Profile Computer Chassis. The Full Size Bracket is Milled/Prepped for DVI & HDMI Port Sockets.. However; the (2) Mount Brackets For Low Profile Chassis are NOT Milled/Prepped for DVI or HDMI The 2 Small Brackets That are Shipped Within the Box are Useless..... 100% Waste of Time and Money Worthless !
customer_reviews.author: Ronaldo Martino

customer_reviews.title: One problem to look out for
customer_reviews.text: The HDMI interface is so close to the DVI that if you are using a compact DVI-to-HDMI (F-to-M) adapter it will not quite fit. You will need a new adapter that has a bit of HDMI cable on the computer end (like a dongle). I bought the amazon basics one and it solved the problem ... once it arrived Other than that, the card isOk; amazing how much smaller this is than a 2GB passive card of the same edition bought 5 years ago To make this review more useful someoned might test whether this adapter is any better than an onboard intel graphic se bthat supports 2 monitors via DVI and HDMI.
customer_reviews.author: shopper 101

customer_reviews.title: Nice little card for my computer
customer_reviews.text: I have a small tower computer that would not fit a full video card, however I wanted to have more than two monitors connected for presentation software. This card works great! It certainly is not as good as more expensive cards, but for the non-gaming multi-monitor purposes, it works just fine. I like that the card has all three regularly used connections: VGA, DVI and HDMI. The card itself fits easily in my small case, requiring no additional power and having the ability to put the VGA adapter on either side of the card.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse NietzerTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I bouth this card because I have a computer with a dual boot XP and win10 I have a TI-1050 Installed already that works great in win 10 but is not supported in XP so I was stuck with distorted VGA in XP Installed this card and only use it in the XP boot and it works great for my needs Photoshop etc. But not fast enough for games. I recommend if you need a inexpensive card that works well.
customer_reviews.author: Alan B Link

customer_reviews.title: Great for HP Slimline s5710f
customer_reviews.text: Needed an upgrade for my wife's old HP Slimline s5710f desktop so she could play some Steam games that require a DX11 capable card. Integrated graphics on the Slimline only support DX10. Price was right, installation was a breeze. Came with a low profile bracket. Downloaded drivers from Nvidia.com Even though a 300 watt power supply is listed as being required, this seems to be working fine with the stock 220 watt power supply, but I have a 350 watt slim PSU saved in my cart just in case. Been monitoring the performance and so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mantle

customer_reviews.title: a nice low wattage video card.
customer_reviews.text: Let's say you have an older desktop with a PCI 1.0 slot and your video card is either weak or fan died or whatever. This video card is absolutely perfect for a desktop that sees light games and general surfing and watching videos. I ran this on two different older computers and it works perfectly for my needs. Also, it's passively cooled and makes no additional noise. Having the 3 different video options to use is a plus as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to install (just plug it in) and the computer ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a cheap alternative to a new computer. I play World of Warcraft and after the latest patch (7.3), my onboard video would no longer work. It was easy to install (just plug it in) and the computer did the rest. I'm now running 78 FPS. Love it
customer_reviews.author: stoogesguy

customer_reviews.title: but when you install a dedicated card like this one
customer_reviews.text: I used this in a HP ProLiant DL360 Gen8 Server. I needed a low-power, low-profile card and this worked perfectly. The only issue is that after installing a dedicated graphics card, the HP iLO remote console feature does not work. The onboard graphics feeds the display into the iLO system for viewing over the network, but when you install a dedicated card like this one, the onboard graphics are disabled. As long as the system boots, though, I can use Remote Desktop or PROXMOX to control the system.
customer_reviews.author: Nick L

customer_reviews.title: Problems with refurbished devices. Still bad anyway
customer_reviews.text: Device black screened on any kind of nvidia driver install. This is likely due to the refurbished card I received, and not a knock on 710's in general. This is OK enough to get a 1080p screen running. Everything outside of that is pretty terrible. With web apps taking up more resources, the 710 struggles sometimes. I'd just spend a little more and bump up to a Radeon WX 3100. It is a much more suitable workstation card.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J. Waggoner

customer_reviews.title: Great Card for a Older PC
customer_reviews.text: This card does support 3 outputs at once Just use lower resultions...Got this for my work PC and it smokes the Intel onboard GFX... Monitor #1 HDMI Cable Monitor #2 DVI to HDMI Cable Monitor #3 VGA Cable All running at 1152x648 Get something more powerful for gaming But for what I needed this is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: George W.

customer_reviews.title: Arrived D.O.A.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased one of these before and it worked well in a slim case pc. The drivers that are on the included cd are obsolete. Downloading and installing new drivers takes quite a while. After installing the latest drivers, checking configuration of the BIOS, and verifying configuration there was no video output out of VGA, DVI, or HDMI ports. Device manager in Windows 7 shows that there is no conflict and that correct drivers are installed. Even disabling on board video did not help. Returning for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Was an easy install and Windows 10 picked it up with no ...
customer_reviews.text: I updated a 4 year old Dell XPS 8300 to Windows 10 which did not support the video card I had. Wanted something inexpensive and was pleasantly surprise when I got the ZOTAC card. Was an easy install and Windows 10 picked it up with no additional driver required. I do a lot of work with PDF's and viewing (not editing) DWG files and have had zero problems. Unless your a hard core gamer, this card is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Bob R

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Installed in ACER T865 to upgrade video response. Installation was a snap. Downloaded latest 64 bit software from NVidia site. Software loaded perfectly with no problems at all. No BIOS changes were needed. Plug and play! Was concerned about passive cooling but it runs @ no more than 46C even with heavy video use. A real winner from this end Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Retiree

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: This is obviously not great for any but the most basic gaming, but its fantastic as cheap parent card for a GPU passthrough VM setup; no point in spending a few hundred dollars on a card that's doing basically no work. I imagine it would also be great in a small form factor setup with light demand on the GPU or even as a cheap backup card in case your primary fails.
customer_reviews.author: Super Heavy

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well, driver CD does work
customer_reviews.text: This card seems to work well, although in the past two days the screen has gone black and I get a Windows message stating that the driver crashed. The driver in this case was downloaded from the web site. So today I used the driver CD, and we'll see how that goes. I'm using Win 7 Home Premium 64-bit. The driver CD has older drivers, so perhaps the downloaded driver was a beta version. The drivers take a long time to load from the CD though, and I have a new CD/DVD player/burner.
customer_reviews.author: Old Radio Guy

customer_reviews.title: Nice solid card - no issues!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a low cost card without a noisy fan for my new build, and this is working great. I run 2 monitors routinely from the device, and have a 50" Visio TV above that I can plug in when needed - all 3 displays worked nicely with no issues. (Normally the Vizio is not used and unplugged). This computer is my day-to-day workhorse, and spends it time with 90% web and spreadsheets and about 10% video rendering and/or editing. Nice solid graphics card for a good price. Exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: William C. Dreisbach

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for a failing Graphic Card
customer_reviews.text: My original graphic card in a Dell XPS 8500 began to make noise (fan). I was a little nervous when I purchased this card since I'm running Windows 10 on an older computer (6 years old). When I installed the card and fired up the computer I thought there were going to be problems. I let the system get acquainted with the new board (Windows 10 installed a compatible driver), and when I came back to the computer 15 minutes later I had a perfect display on both monitors. (HDMI and DVI).
customer_reviews.author: Rick Ponzo

customer_reviews.title: Brought an old Mac Pro into this decade!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a Kepler based card to save a 2009 Mac Pro (an otherwise fantastic machine) from being stuck on High Sierra. This card dropped in, quadrupled my VRAM, and natively supports Metal API! Suffice it to say, this happy camper is writing this review from Catalina and is amazed we didn't have to spend $250+ on some flashed RX580 off eBlech. Cheers! (PS also brought us access to some games we couldn't play on 512MB VRAM and it's dead silent! Nice!)
customer_reviews.author: Naomi Follett

customer_reviews.title: more memory and faster than card it replaced for great price. I needed something so specific this was ...
customer_reviews.text: Replacement for a small work machine. Multiple monitor support, low profile, more memory and faster than card it replaced for great price. I needed something so specific this was just about my only choice so I am happy it is working so well. Make sure your current power supply is at least 300 watts, some tiny pc's have 250 or less.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Works for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: I record music and noticed a big sound card introduced latency. Whether it actually adds up and is audible or an issue, idk. So I sold it and bought this one. I actually also dont use the driver for this as the windows default driver works better, to me. Latency was reduced by measure although Im still not sure if that causes a real issue. Picture quality looks fine in 1080. Streaming video isnt that great. Idk if its the driver or the card itself. Works for what I intended though.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: I'm running this on Fedora 27 with current kernel and ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm running this on Fedora 27 with current kernel and Nvidia drivers as of date of review posting. It is running 3 displays with no issue all. Display #1 is 23" HP at 1920x1080 Display #2 and #3 are both Dell 19" at 1280x1024. Only reason I can see to ever change this video card out would be if I wanted to a 4th display which given limits of my desk seems unlikely
customer_reviews.author: Chris Goldsmith

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't compatible with my system
customer_reviews.text: Don't know if it was the card or my system, but did not play well will a Gigabyte B550 motherboard. In the x1 slot Windows would recognize the hardware, but no display. In an x2 slot it would show the display for a few seconds and then promptly crash windows to a reboot. This is with the latest Nvidia drivers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: pcie 2.0 x1, wish there were more cards like this
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my esxi host to passthrough to my plex server. I needed a pcie 2,0 x1 card because i only had that open after raid controller and additional nics. It does plex's hardware encoding with up to two streams.
customer_reviews.author: John F. Ockert

customer_reviews.title: Great to add monitors
customer_reviews.text: I used this graphics card to add 2 monitors to my system (4 total) and it works like a charm. Obviously it is not a high performing card but it works well for what I wanted from it. It came with various adapters so it would fit in shallow cases plus it is one of the few graphics card with is a PCI Express x1 size.
customer_reviews.author: guru

customer_reviews.title: Saved my computer
customer_reviews.text: Plug and play. Can't comment on performance because I don't game. Needed it to replace Intel built in graphics that died. Works great and saved my computer from the recycle bin.
customer_reviews.author: Joel R.

customer_reviews.title: Silence is Golden
customer_reviews.text: Great little card. Easy to install. Silent. Works great. Used for Photoshop, video editing, and office programs. Very little gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Gordon

customer_reviews.title: What I hate is I bought this card for a Lenovo machine ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't seem to want to install in Windows Pro 7....Just can't get it installed...I have taken it to BestBuy Geeks and no luck. I will try one other outfit to see if they can do the BIOS to match this card. What I hate is I bought this card for a Lenovo machine which it said it was compatible with...I wish people who sell this stuff were in the know. I would have returned it but I want to give it another chance with someone that knows how to install it. It seems like just plug and play but it isn't. Windows will not boot with this card installed...so sad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great card when I need a 1x video card for a Linux server
customer_reviews.text: One of the only options when all you have left is a 1x slot because you maxed out your MB with RAID cards and M.2 2280 SSDs. Works great on a Redhat 7.6 server. No issues with drivers at all. Also handles a KVM adapter hooked up to it as well via VGA.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisA

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: Installed easily and comes up in low resolution (800x600). I am using a 1920x1080 monitor connected DVI. I ignored the supplied disk and installed drivers from the nVidia website assuming they would be the latest, rebooted, and the results now 1920x1080.. I am running the card with a very lightweight power supply and so far it's OK. I've had the card for 10 minutes so I have no comment about it's longevity. I will be moving to a higher res monitor and may update the review at that time.
customer_reviews.author: Tony from New Jersey

customer_reviews.title: Stuck this bad boy in a refurb box
customer_reviews.text: So massive plague hits AND my ten year old build starts to act funny - overheating in random ways when playing WoW and Steam games. I don't have enough patience or spare funds to start replacing things part by part and reseat the heat sink, etc. There's literally nothing to do but game right now, so I purchased a cheap refurbished HP Elite which obviously can't run any game out of the box. This low profile card did the trick! Super easy to install and runs like a dream. I was hesitant and concerned about it pulling too much power on the stock PSU but I have had zero issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: centcmd

customer_reviews.title: Difficult installation
customer_reviews.text: The disk supplied did not autorun. I tried to find the file on the disk without success. Went to Nvida on line chat and got 3 minute countdown for help after 3 minutes + got response, no help available. Tried again and got message stating 9 minute wait. Downloaded drivers from web site. Documentation does not state that product not compatible with Edge and won't run without Java. Wasted 2 hours for what should have been a 10 minute job. The product is installed and working much better than their customer support and product documentation departments.
customer_reviews.author: SuperCharlie

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I recently built a server whose PCIe 16x slots were taken by SATA controllers and Network controllers. Since I only needed a video card for basic display, I was hoping to find one that supported PCIe 1x, and this fit the bill. The card works perfectly and its fanless design makes it silent as well. It's a bummer more manufacturers don't make similar offerings, but I'm glad ZOTAC does!
customer_reviews.author: Raj M.

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade for an Acer Aspire xc-603g
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving it five stars for gaming and value because of what it was made for. I was able to connect this via a mini pcie adapter for an Acer Aspire xc-603g, which has built in graphics that have proven to be noticeably lesser than what the GT 710 1GB was able to deliver. The difference was enough to make Minecraft education edition playable. I'd guess a difference in at least 25 fps, considering how ultra choppy the onboard graphics was running it.
customer_reviews.author: badley

customer_reviews.title: If you're like me, you came across this card because you ...
customer_reviews.text: If you're like me, you came across this card because you were looking for something that could drive 3 1080 monitors. I was looking for something cheap, but with the right outputs for my triple display needs. However, I didn't check the maximum resolution of this card. That's all in me, this card was fine, but if you're looking for something that can drive a big array of displays, this isn't it.
customer_reviews.author: Kronecker Delta

customer_reviews.title: Won't start on two late model MBs
customer_reviews.text: I meant to use this for a third monitor for two machines with ASUS H110M-K and Gigabyte H310M A 2.0 motherboards. Thank God I only ordered one to try it out. The Gigabyte BIOS recognized there was a video card installed; the ASUS didn't. Neither would allow the Win10-64 OS to boot, either as sole video card or with primary video, whether Intel CPU or separate nVidia 9800. I correct boot problems as part of my job, so I'm positive it's the board. This one goes back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: S49Nav

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: The card may be okay but the driver freezes my 32 bit windows system on boot up. I contacted support and so far they are virtually no help at all. They said try it on another computer. What!? I don't have another computer/ Regardless, this is the one on which I need it to work. I will absolutely never buy from Zotac again! I suggest you don't either. Worst experience I've ever had installing a video card.
customer_reviews.author: Buckeye1st

customer_reviews.title: Pros: - Budget graphics card. - Boosted on ...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Budget graphics card. - Boosted on integrated graphics. You can still use integrated graphics and utilize the card's gpu computing power. - You can connect it via x1 ports, which means you can upgrade your old laptop with just a mPCIE riser card! You can also make use of the underutilized x1 ports on your motherboard for additional monitors. - low profile capable, no fan needed. Cons: - drivers are conflicting with audio. Having lagging audio vs video
customer_reviews.author: Arvinraj A.

customer_reviews.title: NOT NEW, INCOMPLETE, PARTS MISSING.
customer_reviews.text: Here is how the card was listed. ZOTAC GeForce GT 710 1GB DDR3 PCIE x 1 , DVI, HDMI, VGA, Low Profile Graphic Card (ZT-71304-20L) I ordered as new. The card is a PNY, No Zotac markings anywhere. This is terrible quality control from whomever supplied this. I have wasted a service call ($80). I did not try to use the card since there is no adequate cooling. Nothing holding down the rigged heat sink.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff B.

customer_reviews.title: Works. well kind of.
customer_reviews.text: Only reason I bought it is to be able to hook multiple monitors. Not tested on games. Update: after a month of use, my second monitor takes minimum 3 mins sometimes up to 5 mins to turn on after sleep mode or when I turn on the computer. it's very frustrating specially this computer being used for work purposes.
customer_reviews.author: GeEmWae8

customer_reviews.title: Simple upgrade over integrated graphics
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a little better performance from my office desktop, which runs both a 24-inch 1080p monitor and a 50-inch UHD television that I use for presentations (in 1080p mode). This was, truly, plug & play. Went with Zotac based on previous experience, & am very happy at this point.
customer_reviews.author: CaryBoomer

customer_reviews.title: for x1 PCIE, this GPU works.  Drive 2 monitors fine.  Win10pro and Mint v18.3+ work.
customer_reviews.text: for x1 PCIE, this GPU works. Drive 2 monitors fine. Win10pro and Mint v18.3+ work. Not for heavy gaming or video editing, but fine for business apps, browsing and streaming. I'll update if I try driving 3 monitors.
customer_reviews.author: Eric H

customer_reviews.title: It help m e to set 18 monitors on windows 10.
customer_reviews.text: My workstation plan to set 18 monitors but pci-e slot full of 4 display cards, limit at 16 monitors and windows 10 now lock limit at 16 monitors too. ZOTAC GeForce GT 710 1GB DDR3 PCI-E2.0 2 cards are my answer they can represent 2 slot of a display card and take 1 HDMI and 1 VGA more. It's very difficult to set more monitor with windows 10 but you can use Nvidia control to solve this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Pongthawat Sakprasert

customer_reviews.title: GeForce 7 series FTW
customer_reviews.text: The GeForce 7 series is no joke,. This card maybe small but is definitely worth 50$ and with passive cooling,. Perfect for my SFF HP slimline with OEM 240 watt PSU
customer_reviews.author: Jarod Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a broken GTX660 with this. Wow have they gotten smaller. Only use this on my movie server, no games, but works well for both I think. It goes into the small PCI connector on your motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Chatman Family

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: This video card has served me well in both windows and many different versions of Linux including Ubuntu 16 and 18. I haven't had any problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: jashber

customer_reviews.title: Power saving option gets triggered
customer_reviews.text: Annoying that the power saving option gets triggered and I have to reboot the machine. Machine is not configured to use power saving option. It doesn't come out of power saving option without reboot.
customer_reviews.author: Mutant

customer_reviews.title: After installing the card and driver, the card didn't ...
customer_reviews.text: After installing the card and driver, the card didn't work: the BIOS startup screen appeared, but after that I got only a black screen. And when I called ZOTAC tech support, I was sent to voicemail, and no one returned my call. Very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Gass

customer_reviews.title: Great card for servers with limited x16 ports and no onboard graphics
customer_reviews.text: Card works well and installed easily. Between my raid card and my multi-nic ethernet card I did not have anymore x16 slots on my board. This card fit the bill perfectly and allowed me to install in an x1 slot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: when I put it in it did not work , just hung at bios screen. then I found out I had to update my bios. then it worked perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Anubis

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to install and became a good upgrade to my NVDIA Quadro NVS 295. It came in a very good package with installation cd. You need to make sure your mother board has pci express port before you order this card. Card works properly for now. Windows experience score of this card on my pc is 4.9/7.9. My previous card had windows experience score 2.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: For those who want to save money
customer_reviews.text: My Lenovo is p300 small form factor having an i3 dual core. I mainly bought this for making access to DVI connection for a legacy monitor. It works well without a decrease in graphic performance.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: a step up form the build in graphics in my old system, but no Vega ;)
customer_reviews.author: Polycard A.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and reliable
customer_reviews.text: fast delivery as always. Works good. I don't game, not sure what noise level refers to and screen stuff works well to.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Sandberg

customer_reviews.title: cost effective for the 2 monitors I wanted to add.
customer_reviews.text: cost effective for the 2 monitors I wanted to add. Already had 2 monitors on 1 card, needed another card that didn't require a full size slot and this one worked.
customer_reviews.author: KWBOY

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend to anyone wanting to transform an old PC into ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it for an old PC I had laying around and I was able to convert it into a decent HTPC. Note that this is not suitable for gaming, just for normal use, and possibly some old games. Would recommend to anyone wanting to transform an old PC into a HTPC for movie streaming.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo Aksel

customer_reviews.title: 3 monitors for 1 PC works great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to be able to run 3 monitors for one computer, this has worked perfectly and I am happy with this product and would recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect as a replacement to a dead graphic card in an old Dell.
customer_reviews.text: with this graphic card I can now use maps without the browser crashing. Image looks great. With no fan it is silent.
customer_reviews.author: Night Owl

customer_reviews.title: Review: ZOTAC Graphics Card for macOS.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to help my hackintosh from GixxerPC sleep and work properly under macOS with an HP P201 Display and is very pleased with the ease of installation and time it took to setup of the control software.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Pringle

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and it works great in my media PC
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and it works great in my media PC. So far it has played every format and resolution I could throw at, with zero stuttering. Zero fans means it is extremely quiet and is exactly what you want in your media center. This replaced a Radeon 4830 who's HDMI port bought the farm.
customer_reviews.author: mdan575

customer_reviews.title: Great card!!
customer_reviews.text: Was using onboard Intel graphics before, 10-20 fps at the lowest settings on WoW Classic, blew my expectations out of the water!! Running 100 fps at the same settings, 40 fps at medium settings! Great performing, yet inexpensive card!! Fits in my Dell Optiplex 790 (i3) small form factor after changing the plates (came with those)
customer_reviews.author: Austin Kortright

customer_reviews.title: Used to replace bad hdmi
customer_reviews.text: Not a gamer but got this to replace bad hdmi port on motherboard. Easy installation and works well.
customer_reviews.author: jfd8982

customer_reviews.title: Now everything works great. Just needed something with more power
customer_reviews.text: I was having a problem with an RC simulator program not working. It turned out that my video card was not up to speed so I got this card. Now everything works great. Just needed something with more power.
customer_reviews.author: John H.
